711767f-a.text:
225 West 24th Street, north side between 8th and 7th Avenues showing P.S. 45.

Board of Education. N.Y.C.
1920

710124f-b.text:
(1)
Eighth Avenue at S. W. corner of 24th Street.
Note Republican poster for Hoover and Curtis in 1928 presidential campaign.
September 14, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
(2)
The same, at a later date. These buildings bear Nos. 277-275 and 273 Eighth Ave. On the right of the view is seen West 24th Street, north side, west of Eighth Ave.
December 26, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

711770f-a.text:
239-263 West 24th Street, north side, east of Eighth Avenue. In the centre is the Jeanne D'Arc Home for Girls.
March 6, 1931
P. L. Sperr

710125f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, north from W. 24th Street (right), as viewed from a point on the west side of the Avenue close to 23rd Street. The large office structure shown is at N.E. corner of West 26th Street and is of recent construction.

Note the cobblestone street pavement and the surface car tracks. On the completion of the Municipal Subway (Eighth Avenue) both of these features will disappear.

View No. 2 is taken from the S.E. corner of 24th Street and shows a view up the east east side of the Avenue.

View 1: June 25, 1928
View 2: Mar. 21, 1938
P. L. Sperr

1558078.title: 270 Eighth Avenue - West 24th Street
1558078.folder: 270 Eighth Avenue - West 24th Street, Manhattan, NY

710126f-a.text:
284 to 294 Eighth Avenue, east side, north of West 24th, to 25th Streets, as shown in two portions, consisting of buildings numbered 284 to 288 (in View No. 2) and 288 to 294 (View No. 1). The latter are at the S.E. corner of this thoroughfare and West 25th Street. Note the Eighth Avenue Mission at No. 290 and slightly to the south of same. View No. 3 is similar, showing a better perspective of the aforementioned Mission.

No. 1  June 25, 1928.
2  About 1910
3  March 21, i938.

P. L. Sperr (No's. 1 & 3)

Anonymous Gift (No. 2)
